titles.title: Federal Judgeship Act of 2008
Federal Judgeship Act of 2008
A bill to provide for the appointment of additional Federal circuit and district judges, and for other purposes.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR 3/14/2008 S2153-2154)
Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary. (text of measure as introduced: CR 3/14/2008 S2154-2155)

calendar.text: Committee on the Judiciary. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on the Judiciary. Reported by Senator Leahy without amendment. With written report No. 110-427. Additional, Minority and Supplemental views filed.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 891.

bill.summary:
7/21/2008--Reported to Senate without amendment. (This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)
Federal Judgeship Act of 2008 - Directs the President to: (1) appoint additional circuit judges for the first, second, third, sixth, eighth, and ninth circuit courts of appeals and temporary judges for the ninth circuit court of appeals; and (2) appoint additional permanent and temporary district judges for districts in specified states.
